epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_code: NSW - Byron Bay - Climate Active - NZ252L
product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete

classification.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
classification.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note: Environmental impacts from existing EPDs do not include EN15804+A1 and Green Star (v1.3) impact categories; these are modelled separately

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere over its lifetime via carbonation
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

NSW_ACT.composition: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.composition: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.composition: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.composition: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.composition: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Scientific articles on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
